intro: Ophiocaulon reticulatum, commonly known as the netleaf pellitory, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has a shallow root system. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Ophiocaulon reticulatum is often found in shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
